Description: Redware pottery jar with a shallow pointed base, convex sides, a short concave neck and an everted rim, decorated with a white slip.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Bibliographic references: Zitman 2010 / The necropolis of Assiut: a case study of local Egyptian funerary culture from the Old Kingdom to the end of the Middle Kingdom (II, 236)
Rzeuska 2017 / Chronological Overview of Pottery from Asyut (142-143) (Catalogue number 81. Erroneously associated with tomb 36.)
